answers.answer: Hi, migraine has nothing to do with blood clot; do you have history of hypertension or diabetes? Patients with hypertension or dyslipidemia are prone to clot formation. Please follow doctor’s advice and get yourself examined. Keep taking aspirin as it helps in preventing clot formation.

question: could a migrain cause a blood clot in the artery of the eye and cause you to see black  in that eye. Any way to get rid of the black vision. The artery is very small and could not be surgicly removed. On asprin. Please helpThis discussion is related tohttp://www.medhelp.org/posts/show/294085.
title: blod clot in artery of the eye & migraines
